CHARISMATIC.Definition: charming and able to attract others easily

TIPPED.Definition: predicted or suggested as likely to happen

GRAPPLING WITH.Definition: struggling with or trying to deal with

HUNG PARLIAMENT.Definition: a situation where no single party had a majority of seats in parliament

SPECTRE.Definition: a ghost or something that caused fear or worry

GAMBLER.Definition: someone who played games of chance for money

NANNY.Definition: a woman who took care of children

NEATLY.Definition: in a tidy and orderly way

SHAME.Definition: a painful feeling of guilt or disgrace

WITHDRAWAL.Definition: taking money out of his bank account

OFF.Definition: not quite right or a bit strange

TELLER.Definition: person who worked in the bank, handling money transactions

SCAR.Definition: a mark left on the skin after a wound had healed

THIGH.Definition: the part of the leg between the hip and the knee

HAD HIS EYES SET ON.Definition: aimed or planned to achieve it

TOP JOB.Definition: the highest or most important position

PRINCIPLED.Definition: having strong beliefs about what is right and wrong

HUNG ON HIS EVERY WORD.Definition: listened very carefully to everything he said

CONSTITUENCY.Definition: an area represented by a member of parliament

PROPERTY BOOM.Definition: rapid increase in the value of property

MESS.Definition: a situation that was full of problems

WAS IN TATTERS.Definition: was ruined or in very bad condition

CORRUPTIBLE.Definition: able to be bribed or influenced to do something dishonest

HANDLERS.Definition: people who managed or controlled him

TARGETED.Definition: chosen as a target or person of interest

PAID HIM HANDSOMELY.Definition: gave him a lot of money

VEHEMENTLY.Definition: in a forceful or intense way

STROLLING AROUND.Definition: walking in a relaxed way around

DISCERNIBLE.Definition: able to be seen or noticed

GETAWAY KIT.Definition: a set of items prepared for a quick escape

PSYCHOTIC.Definition: relating to a severe mental disorder that affects how you think, feel, and behave

EXTRADITED.Definition: sent back to another country to face legal charges

KNOCK-ON.Definition: causing other events to happen as a result

OVERWHELMED.Definition: overcome with strong emotions or stress

LOST ALL GRIP ON REALITY.Definition: become unable to understand what was real and what was not

LOSING ALL GRIP ON REALITY.Definition: becoming unable to understand what was real and what was not
